detaileddescription.para: Constructs a SephoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.
Clones a SephoneAddress object.
Increment reference count of SephoneAddress object.
Decrement reference count of SephoneAddress object. When dropped to zero, memory is freed.
Returns the address scheme, normally "sip".
Returns the display name.
Returns the username.
Returns the domain name.
Sets the display name.
Sets the username.
Sets the domain.
Sets the port number.
Set a transport.
Get the transport.
Removes address's tags and uri headers so that it is displayable to the user.
Returns the address as a string. The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().
Returns the SIP uri only as a string, that is display name is removed. The returned char * must be freed by the application. Use ms_free().

Returns true if address refers to a secure location (sips) Deprecated
use sephone_address_get_secure()
Returns true if address refers to a secure location (sips)

Make the address refer to a secure location (sips scheme)
enabled
TRUE if address is requested to be secure.
returns true if address is a routable sip address

Compare two SephoneAddress ignoring tags and headers, basically just domain, username, and port.
a1
SephoneAddress object
a2
SephoneAddress object
Boolean value telling if the SephoneAddress objects are equal.
sephone_address_equal()

Compare two SephoneAddress taking the tags and headers into account.
a1
SephoneAddress object
a2
SephoneAddress object
Boolean value telling if the SephoneAddress objects are equal.
sephone_address_weak_equal()

Destroys a SephoneAddress object (actually calls sephone_address_unref()). Deprecated
Use sephone_address_unref() instead
Get port number as an integer value. Get port number, 0 if not present.

Set the password encoded in the address. It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
addr
the SephoneAddress
passwd
the password to set.

Get the password encoded in the address. It is used for basic authentication (not recommended).
addr
the address
the password, if any, NULL otherwise.

Set a header into the address. Headers appear in the URI with '?', such as <sip:test@linphone.org?SomeHeader=SomeValue>.
addr
the address
header_name
the header name
header_value
the header value

Create a SephoneAddress object by parsing the user supplied address, given as a string.
lc
SephoneCore object
address
String containing the user supplied address
The create SephoneAddress object
